headline.main: GENERAL TELEGRAPH NEWS; THE LOSS OF THE EMILY B. SOUDER. ADDITIONAL PARTICULARS OF THE DISASTER --A LEAK WHICH COULD NOT BE STOPPED --NO TIDINGS OF THE PASSENGERS AND CREW.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Dec. 26.--The State Line steam-ship state of Lousiana, which struck on Hunter's Rock, in Lough Larne, Ireland, on the morning of the 24th inst., is still on the rock....
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Dec. 26.--The State Line steam-ship state of Lousiana, which struck on Hunter's Rock, in Lough Larne, Ireland, on the morning of the 24th inst., is still on the rock.

headline.main: CURRENT EVENTS ABROAD.; THE STEAM-SHIP LOUISIANA STILL ON HUNTER'S ROCK--AN EARLY ENDING OF THE OLDHAM STRIKE EXPECTED--ROYAL BETROTHALS.

docs.snippet: The steam-ship Amerique, of the French Line, which arrived from Havre yesterday, was signale I on the afternoon of the 23d inst. in latitude 49 16' and longitude 28 36' by the British ship Bridgewater, bound from London for St. John, NewBrunswick,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The steam-ship Amerique, of the French Line, which arrived from Havre yesterday, was signale I on the afternoon of the 23d inst. in latitude 49 16' and longitude 28 36' by the British ship Bridgewater, bound from London for St. John, NewBrunswick, and took from her Capt. Malcoha Macauley and 12 of the crew of this bark AngloSaxon, of London, which was abandoned in latitude

headline.main: DISASTER ON THE HUDSON.; HEAVILY-LADEN CANAL-BOAT WRECKED IN A GALE, AND HER CAPTAIN, HIS WIFE, AND TWO YOUNG CHILDREN DROWNED.

byline.original: Special Dispatch to the New-York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LONG BRANCH, May 31.--During the fearful north-east gale which swept this part of the coast last night, the schooner E.M. Attwood, of Providence, R.I., was cast upon the shore at Deal Beach, about four miles south of Long Branch. The storm is said by old surfmen to be one of the severest and longest that has visited the Jersey coast for years at ...
